Bamsoet Ajak Anggota Motor Besar Indonesia Terapkan 4 Pilar Bangsa
03 Nov 2019, 21:11 by Adinda Purnama Rachmani
Jakarta - Ketua MPR Bambang Soesatyo mengajak anggota Motor Besar Indonesia (MBI) menerapkan empat pilar bangsa. MBI harus menunjukan bahwa melalui hobi otomotif, bisa menjadi saluran meneguhkan ikatan persaudaraan sesama anak bangsa.
"Stigma bahwa dunia otomotif hanya untuk kalangan atas dan tak menjangkau rakyat kecil juga tak selamanya benar. Di sini kita tak pernah melihat status sosial maupun latar belakang SARA, serta profesi pekerjaan. Penyaluran hobi melalui komunitas juga bukan untuk mengotakkan diri, melainkan untuk memudahkan proses tukar pengalaman, tukar pikiran, maupun gagasan. Dari kesamaan hobi inilah kira rajut kesamaan perjuangan untuk memberikan sumbangsih kepada Indonesia untuk lebih maju, adil, dan beradab," ujar Bamsoet dalam acara tasyakuran MBI, di Jakarta, Minggu (3/11/2019).
Pengurus dan anggota Motor Besar Indonesia (MBI) bangga atas dilantiknya Ketua Dewan Pembina MBI Bambang Soesatyo sebagai Ketua MPR RI. Kepercayaan baru yang diemban Bamsoet sebagai Ketua MPR RI menunjukan bahwa aktivitas hobi, baik itu bermotor maupun lainnya, selama dijalankan dengan proporsional tak akan menganggu pengabdian dalam tugas kenegaraan.
"Masing-masing orang punya kegemaran, entah itu di aktivitas otomotif, olahraga, maupun seni budaya. Karenanya, tak ada yang salah dengan bergabung dalam komunitas hobi. Tak perlu takut hobi menganggu pekerjaan, justru karena memiliki hobi dan terhindar dari stress, pekerjaan bisa dijalankan dengan maksimal," tuturnya.
Wakil Ketua Umum Pemuda Pancasila ini menjelaskan contoh krusial menjalankan nilai-nilai Empat Pilar yang paling mudah dilakukan bagi anggota MBI. Di antaranya adalah dengan menerapkan keselamatan berkendara, tidak ugal-ugalan, apalagi melanggar peraturan berlalu lintas.
"Jalan raya kita tak ubahnya seperti rimba hutan. Tak jarang kita saksikan pengendara main serobot lampu lalu lintas, motong jalan tanpa perhitungan keselamatan, ugal-ugalan di jalan seenaknya. Padahal, peradaban sebuah bangsa dapat dilihat dari kondisi lalu lintas warganya dalam berkendara di jalan raya. Ketertiban ini memang terlihat sepele, tapi nilainya justru sangat tinggi," pungkas Bamsoet.

Bamsoet Invites Members of Large Indonesian Motorcycles to Apply 4 Pillars of the Nation
Nov 03 2019, 21:11 by Adinda Purnama Rachmani
Jakarta - MPR Chair Bambang Soesatyo invited members of the Indonesian Big Motor (MBI) to implement the four pillars of the nation. MBI must show that through the automotive hobby, it can be a channel to strengthen the bonds of brotherhood among the nation's children.
"The stigma that the automotive world is only for the upper classes and does not reach the small people is also not always true. Here we never see the social status or background of SARA, as well as the occupational profession. Distribution of hobbies through the community is also not to compartmentalize itself, but to facilitate the process exchange experiences, exchange ideas, and ideas. From the similarity of hobbies, we think that we are struggling to contribute to Indonesia to be more advanced, fair, and civilized, "Bamsoet said at the MBI ceremony, in Jakarta, Sunday (11/03/2019) .
The management and members of the Indonesian Big Motor (MBI) are proud of the appointment of MBI Board of Trustees Chairman Bambang Soesatyo as Chair of the Indonesian MPR. The new trust held by Bamsoet as Chair of the MPR RI shows that hobby activities, whether motorized or otherwise, as long as they are run proportionally will not disrupt service in the state duties.
"Everyone has a passion, whether it's in automotive activities, sports, and cultural arts. Therefore, there's nothing wrong with joining a hobby community. No need to be afraid of hobbies interfering with work, precisely because it has a hobby and avoid stress, work can run optimally, "he said.
The Deputy Chairperson of the Pancasila Youth explained the crucial example of carrying out the values of the Four Pillars that is most easily done for MBI members. Among them is by applying driving safety, not reckless, let alone breaking traffic rules.
"Our highway is like a jungle jungle. Not infrequently we see motorists playing traffic lights, chopping roads without safety calculations, reckless on the road at will. In fact, the civilization of a nation can be seen from the traffic conditions of its citizens in driving on the road "Order does look trivial, but its value is very high," concluded Bamsoet.
